review: Family of 4 was split to single seats. To make things worse, we were all assigned middle seats so other "single" passengers did not want to switch. Why would you separate a family with 2 kids? We fly out twice a year for vacations. No longer flying Frontier and Spirit. Adding Delta to that list.

Delta Airlines customer service was bad. Staff members were unhelpful and unprofessional of the delayed flight. Staff was very rude and even laughed at me while asking questions. I asked the  questions respectfully and I am baffled for the unprofessionalism. No one knew how to give direct answers on how to fix their mistake on my delayed flight. Rather received a mockery attitude and much uncertain answers. Save your money and go fly elsewhere please.

I purchased a ticket for a flight on May 23rd. They gave me a ticket for May 24th. When I pointed out that it was their error and that they gave me the incorrect ticket, they refused to assist me. I was forced to purchase a fare adjustment to be placed back on the correct flight that I actually purchased. After several commissions through different channels, they have thus far refused to refund the fraudulent fare adjustment charge with no explanation or apology for their neglect and incompetence.

I was charged $1486.20 on the Nov.3rd 2023 when I bought the tickets, then was charged again for $1486.20 on the 5th. I called Delta after finally getting connected to someone who can speak English, I was told they can't refund me because they only have the ticket numbers I paid for and to call my bank. My bills are passed due now and I have late fees on my rent/phone etc. Will never fly Delta again. Especially after insinuating I was lying when I have my bank statement.

After a delayed take off we missed our connecting flights. The person at the Delta counter (Kristie) was very helpful in rebooking us. She went above and beyond to get us the best rebook possible. Thank You Delta / Kristie.

I'm handicapped and specifically booked 1st class to be sure I have some comfort from LAX to OGG. However, this was the worst experience in over 35 years of flying. For 839$ (one way!) I got less space and comfort than on Hawaiian Airlines economy. The cabin was ice cold, no seat extension or anything, max 10°reclining possible. I took several pictures, some attaching. I expected an apology or refund, nada. Do not fly Delta.

I am writing to express my profound disappointment with the service I received on Delta Flight 800. I have always chosen Delta for its reputation for superior service and reliability, but my recent experience has made me reconsider that choice. To begin with, I was taken aback when, after upgrading to Comfort Class, I was relocated from an aisle seat to a middle seat without any prior notification or choice. Such a switch considerably reduced the comfort level I had anticipated with the upgrade. This was the first sign of my forthcoming ordeal. Upon addressing my concern at the airport, I was given a sheer run-around, being referred from one agent to another, with each passing the responsibility onto someone else. It felt as though my comfort and satisfaction as a customer were not valued in the slightest. My in-flight experience was no better. The flight attendants seemed disinterested and distant, making me feel more like a burden than a valued passenger. My simple request for an apple juice was met with confusion as I was handed a diet coke instead. This may seem like a trivial mistake, but it's indicative of the lack of attention to passenger needs. Moreover, after requesting headsets to perhaps distract myself from the accumulating frustrations, I had to repeat my request. Waiting an hour for such a basic amenity is unacceptable, especially when I could see other passengers receiving prompt service. I had hoped that my upgrade to Comfort Class would ensure a pleasant journey, but I found myself facing a series of disappointments and inconveniences. The lack of coordination, attention to detail, and basic courtesy have left a lasting negative impression. I urge Delta to look into these matters seriously. No passenger should feel as undervalued and disregarded as I did on Flight 800.

The flight attendants on my flight were absolutely the greatest ever. Kennedy, Brigit, Robin & Goldie made me feel comfortable and relaxed during my emergency flight to Idaho to see my dying sister. They checked on my well being throughout the flight and stopped by my seat to give me hugs. I'm so grateful for the crew.

route: Providence to Dallas Fort-Worth via LaGuardia
review: Inbound flight from PVD to DFW via LGA was on a CRJ900. This aircraft is comfortable with plenty of legroom; however, the overhead cabins are too small to hold a carry on bag with outside pocket. No delay and smooth flight to LGA. Connecting flight to DFW was on a A220-300. This is an awesome aircraft. If I could fly the A220-300 all the time I would do it. The engines are very quiet. The seats are wider than bigger single aisle planes and very comfortable. The overhead cabins are large enough to accommodate carryon bags. The bathrooms are spacious more so than on larger single aisle planes e.g. B737 and/or A320s. No delay on either leg and the cabin crews were very friendly offering snacks periodically. In flight WiFi worked flawlessly on A220 but was spotty on CRJ 900. I haven't flown DL in quite come time, but I definitely would fly this airline again.

I hold a business class ticket from Air France. Air France cancelled my flight and rebooked me with Delta. Things seemed to be smooth as I could select my seat, 1D, and checked on Delta's website that the seat was reserved,  until Delta required me to check-in at the airport. I went to the Delta One section, the check-in agent was very nice and found my reservation, provided to me a boarding pass, only without a seat number. She made several attempts to request for one, but the system only allowed my seat to be assigned at the gate. Not only that, my boarding pass neither showed the class of service nor Sky Priority status, though she ensured me several times that I would be travelling in Delta One. The inconvenience began from there, with the security agent refused to allow me to use the Sky Priority line; not an issue as I was early. I did not get access to the Sky Club; not an issue either as I still could do it with my Amex Platinum card but chose to skip as the Sky Club was packed with a long waiting line. The gate agent finally assigned me a seat, exactly my seat 1D, but only until an hour before boarding. With US carriers having a reputation of dumping passengers for no reason, being through that process is not fun. It got a lot better on board, though not necessarily excellent. Cabin staff were very nice and accommodating. Food was just average in taste, and the whole meal was served on a single tray. I flew Delta One from JFK to Frankfurt a year earlier, and the meal was delicious and was properly served course after course. Not sure why there is such disparity on 2 very comparable routes. The semi-Delta One Suite was more spacious and comfortable than I thought, but it still lagged behind many leading products out there. Why do I still recommend the airline? Because I could see efforts from staff to help me. It was their system that was bad.

Bad attitude and customer service. I was flying from San Diego to Detroit on Delta. The Delta representative in the boarding was very rude. She made sure to stop me as she said I have three items (backpack, carry-on and small 6x4” crossbody). I had to step out of the lane put my crossbody inside the backpack. I had to lose my flower bouquets (the one my daughter gave me for my birthday) because of my 6x4” crossbody. I’m not sure what was her problem with me, but it was obvious she is not treating everyone equal as three people in front of me, including my husband, had three items with them and she let them go to the plain without saying anything to them. I am very disappointed with Delta staff. Delta was my first stop to shop for flight it will not be anymore for sure. I am using my mileage on the Delta Amex then I will not care about it anymore. You lost a good customer Delta.

This review pertains to the SkyMiles program. During the months of January and February in 2023, I embarked on a series of flights with Delta's partner airlines, which included LATAM, Aerolineas Argentinas, and Saudia. Regrettably, I failed to input my SkyMiles number when booking these flights. Consequently, I had to request mileage credit post-flight, a process that is typically straightforward. However, my experience with Delta proved to be far from hassle-free. Securing mileage credit from Delta proved to be an ordeal that required multiple requests and calls to customer service before any credit was recorded. It was not until September, a full seven months after my initial application, that I finally received mileage credit for the Saudia flights. Astonishingly, during a call with an agent in March, I was told my requests had been “archieved” and thus not acted upon. Then, when I called again in October, the agent advised that they had no record whatsoever that I had put in any request – this despite the fact that the agent in March had advised that my requests were safely in and I need not put them in again. It wasn't until October, following yet another customer service call, that I was granted the deserved credit for the Aerolineas Argentinas flights. However, the same agent informed me that she was unable to credit me for the LATAM flights, citing allegedly missing information in the documents I provided (boarding passes and receipts). In response, I diligently explained via email that all the requisite information was indeed included in the documents, but received no response. When I acquired a letter from LATAM confirming the presence of all necessary details and forwarded it to the agent with a request for confirmation of receipt, I was met with silence once more. Upon reaching out to Delta customer service to follow up, I was met with an abrupt response, being told that I "could not keep calling them," despite this being only my initial follow-up call, and that further contact would supposedly further delay the process. The agent then refused to provide me with any case number or confirmation number for my call – which goes against most customer service protocols. The culmination of these experiences has led me to the unfortunate realization that Delta's customer service falls far short of the expected standards, characterized by contradictory instructions, leading customers on wild goose chases to obtain information already provided, and gaslighting of customers. It appears that this deliberate "intentional friction" is designed with the expectation that customers will eventually abandon their pursuit of rightful mileage credit. Such service is incredibly disappointing for an airline that is purportedly renowned for its high level of customer service in the United States.

This business class was horrible. The beds were so small and tight that I nor my 2 friends got any sleep. We were so disappointed and really felt ripped off for spending 5 grand on this through princess ezair. You’re so busy trying to saved a buck that you cram in too many seats. It’s a joke to call this business class. Have to fly home November 3. Not looking forward to being up again all night.
Despite a long flight. Enjoyed meal and snacks provided. The inflight entertainment was good. The seats were very close and there is not much leg room.

route: Tel Aviv to New York JFK
review: I purchased a flight from Tel Aviv to JFK, they made an Emergency Landing in Dublin Ireland, their system was down so they couldn't provide any new flights, I paid $1300 for a new flight for me and my wife. And now after applying for reimbursements and being with them on Hold I got this email from Delta saying "I understand you received a $200 travel voucher (they didn't) from our Proactive Service Recovery team, as we understand this trip was not as pleasant as it should have been. The compensation provided is not meant to place a value on your experience; rather it is an attempt to make amends for your disappointment with our service. You mentioned you had to book a ticket on another airline. While we share your disappointment, we hope you understand we are unable to consider reimbursement for other airline tickets, unused hotels, car rentals, recreational tickets, lost wages/income, child/pet care, or loss of time in these instances. Accordingly, we are unable to honor your request. We realize this is a disappointment, and trust you understand our position".

route: Palm Beach to Philadelphia via Atlanta
review: I've never missed a connecting flight before. Our Delta plane landed on time but had to wait for a gate. I missed my flight by 5 mins. A group of us watched from inside the airport while the plane just sat there. I thought they would wait to close the gate especially since we were going from one delta flight to another. I will avoid booking with Delta from now on and avoid layovers at Atlanta International.

Delta is terrible. I had a flight scheduled to depart at 4pm and arrive in Atlanta at 6:45 where I needed to connect to another flight that left at 7:10. That main flight delayed 3x and I had to change my connecting flight twice until finally for the 3rd time there were no more connecting flights. They offered me another flight the next day that would arrive too late for my purpose of travel. Thanks to delta I missed my cousins funeral.

Spent a lot of money for a Delta one ticket. 1 hour into a 11 hour flight, my inflight entertainment stopped working. Despite the flight attendant attempting to restart it, it still didnt work. I was stuck there for close to 10 hours without any in flight entertainment. I filed a complaint, and only received a measly 10,000 points (monetary value of $100). I replied advising that this felt inadequate, and the response I received was that this was the maximum they offered for this kind of issue. Extremely disappointed, spent $2000 for terrible experience, and all they offer is $100 in return. Will never fly Delta again if I can avoid it.

Twenty minutes into the flight one of the two toilets on board for main cabin and economy class passengers stopped working. The only functioning toilet door was very difficult to open and the toilet was cleaned only once during the entire 5hr flight. The reason why I know that is because I was sitting in an exit row close to the toilets. Secondly, one of the flight attendants was rather rude she has no customer service skills and it was evident that she really did not want to do her job. We will never fly with Delta Air Lines again.

1st Delta changed all 4 of our family's seats and double booked our 13 year old child and he was forced to stand for part of the flight. Then we landed in Atlanta and our connecting flight was cancelled to Huntsville, AL. They of course blamed weather so they wouldn't have to be held accountable although a flight (DL1726) flew out of Atlanta to Huntsville an hour later. We were told at the ticket counter our next available flight would be 3 days later and if that wasn't "good enough" we would have to choose ground transportation and we would be reimbursed for the flight not taken and a rental car. We were given the runaround for over 8 weeks now and over 5 hours of our time for Delta to offer us $25 credit towards our cancelled flight (not money back) and now they won't even reimburse us our $275 rental car to drive through the night to get our child to NASA Space camp on a Sunday. Very Disappointed!

The ticketing agent cancelled my leg of the flight to Orlando from Detroit for today when rebooking my second leg despite telling us otherwise on the phone. The agent today that we spoke to from the airport was not helpful and just told us to buy a new ticket which would be over $500. I have been forced to fly another airline separately from my family with great inconvenience. The agent who messed up my reservation on August 22nd should be reprimanded for her incompetence and negligence causing emotional and financial stress. Such agents shouldn't be allowed to work for Delta. Extremely poor service experience both then and today. Pity, I used to think Delta was one of the better airlines .

Absolute trash company. We bought flights months ago with miles and the company overbooked the flight. The flight was originally for 10:30 am and they decided to put us on the 7:30 am flight. When I called to fix the problem I was told their rates had gone up and they offered me the original flight but in the main cabin rather than comfort +. I was told I'll have to take the flight and ask for a refund. I was told the refund department will decide if we get a refund or not. I've never had this many problems with American Airlines.

route: Los Angeles to Rochester via New York
review: I've unfortunately already booked a couple more flights with this airline, but that will be the last time. I thought that Delta's standards had improved over the years, but I had the worst airline experience on September 29th at LAX's terminal 3. I got to the airport early and I had my dog in his carrier. I got stopped by a female employee who told me that my dog was too big for his carrier. This is not the case, he is a chihuahua mix, and I have flown with my dog many times with no issues on much longer flights. She did not offer any solutions, just told me I could not fly with the carrier I had. I got in line to talk to customer service to figure out what my options were, and she then ushered me over again with a manager. The manager told me I could only fly with my dog if I purchased a different carrier from Delta. While the manager went to get the carrier, I waited for 45-50 minutes and almost ran out of time to check my bag. When the manager came back, she had a carrier the same size if not smaller than the one I walked in with. I was flustered and just wanted to get on my flight since I was running out of time, and they charged me $75 for a cramped Delta-branded carrier. I was stressed, my dog was stressed, and I had to literally run through the airport, jostling my poor dog, to make my flight in time (5 minutes later and I would have missed it.) It felt like a weird, gross scam and it was the most stressed out I've ever been dealing with an airline before. I fly extremely frequently (6-12 roundtrip flights a year via various airlines) but Delta has lost my business for good.

route: New York JFK to Montego Bay
review: This airline truly marked the beginning of my vacation. I was travelling with my family to Jamaica and we already had bad experience at JFK Airport. Thankfully, this airline was a polar opposite of the airport. The staff was very kind and the food was good. Thank you Delta.

route: San Francisco to Santiago de Chile via Atlanta
review: One of my worst journeys ever! Our experience started with the inability to check in online on Delta.com and paying for a 3rd additional suitcase, which forced us to get up early and to stand in line at terminal 2 at SFO airport, with the aggressive handling of a red suited male supervisor, making is repack our suitcases. After this stress we made it to near our departing gate for DL 916 to ATL right in time. We wanted to buy a sandwich and the departure screen showed on time for our flight. No sign of boarding, so we took our time. Suddenly the panel changed to last call, a practice I had seen in no other airport in the world. When notifying the harsh eyed lady at the Delta boarding gate, she only shrugged her shoulders and said this was the airport not the airline responsible for this wording. Guest feedback obviously is valued at Delta Airlines. Being a Skyteam frequent flyer with Air France Flying Blue, I wanted to connect to the wifi, but this was only allowed to Delta Skymiles members - or if I wanted to register with Delta Skymiles - an aberration if I am already a member with Flying Blue. Changing flight in Atlanta, we found ourselves in a packed plane and our seats being 50F and E, we could not even place our travelling backpacks in the overhead department, because two of these overheads were filled with the return flight staff equipment, so we had to squeeze these bags between our legs during 9 hours. On top of this Delta has one of the smallest leg space for its economy customers, as seen to this date. A horror of a night in an airplane and hardly will Delta see us ever book them again.

Ah, Delta. I have been loyal for over 40 years. In that time, I cannot count the number of times I said "I love my Delta Airlines". But lately, Delta has gone downhill. My latest flight international to Nice, FR, I took a chance on "Premium Select" class. A complete and utter waste of money. For the same price, I could have flown true business class with half a dozen other airlines - and gotten a full recline sleeper vs the garbage extra 1/2" seat. I'm talking $1800 more (one way) to fly on Delta. Never again will I fly Delta internationally. Domestically, Delta is a second rate airline - another half dozen budget airlines have better pricing and a better experience. I consider Delta now a "cattle car" carrier. And the latest snub on sky miles, I will do everything I can to not fly Delta anymore and promote those airlines who care. Sadly, the Delta employees continue to be the most courteous and professional. But Delta, the writing is on the wall, you will become a "has been" airline.

Mostly a very decent experience, by the lower standards we have become used to. On time departure, early arrival. Comfortable seat for a 5 hour flight. Dinner was weird, A fairly robust main dish portion ( veggie lasagna) but that’s it. No app, no sales, no side veggie. Served on a tray with a pre wrapped cookie. Wow. Highlights were the entertainment system and exemplary service by the lone flight attendant brilliantly and tirelessly serving 20 people on his own. Talk about rising to the occasion! This guy deserves a raise!

We will never fly Delta again. Flight DL 1689 out of Seattle to Phoenix our connection was very short and had to literally run through the Seattle Airport, which is a nightmare in it self. I had asked a ticket for help in notifying the gate of this dilemma and received no help at all. I am 84 years old and had to run to the gate and when I got there my wife was trying to hold the gate and was told they couldn't do that, very unhelpful. I was last to board and the plane was packed like sardines and our seat was second to last row. To compound the situation, the person behind me was sick and kept sneezing on me between the seats. I could go on but from what I see from Delta, it will fall on deaf ears.

route: Kansas City to Edinburgh via Atlanta
review: I was booked on a flight Aug 24 to Edinburgh through Atlanta. I paid extra for a comfort seat (about $100) after I'd made the initial booking. I made the booking through Orbitz. The ticket was for a Virgin Atlantic flight operated by Delta. Delta called me at 8:57 am, Aug 24, about 10 minutes before I was to leave for the airport. They asked if I would be willing to be re-routed through Boston because MCI-ATL was over-sold. I was offered $300 which was accepted. Comfort seats were not available on the MCI-Boston flight so I was put into the main cabin. I called Delta when I got to the airport to say I also wanted a refund on the comfort seat which was a separate charge on my CC. I was told my CC had already been credited. I called my CC company when I returned and they have no record of impending credits. As of 9/22, it's still not credited. When I got home, I called Delta again and was told they couldn't help me unless I had the MCI-BOS ticket number which I didn't keep and can't find. They said to call Orbitz. Orbit said they couldn't help because Delta called me directly and they didn't have the info. They emailed the flight info they had (MCI-ATL-BOS) which is attached. Orbitz said to contact Virgin Atlantic. Virgin Atlantic also said they couldn't help for the same reason although they forwarded the information I gave them to Delta. I still haven't received a response. Had I been in business class and agreed to be put in the main cabin, I would have credited the difference so why not the $100 I paid for a comfort seat which I'm sure Delta either sold to another passenger or upgraded someone. Everyone else already booked in the main cabin who agreed to switch would have been paid $300. I'm out an extra $100. I have no complaints about the flights themselves or any Delta staff.

On Sunday September 10, my friend and I were returning back to Toronto from LaGuardia airport. We arrive at the airport and are waiting in the bag check line only to see on the screen that our flight was cancelled due to poor weather conditions. This was a surprise to us because we were not notified of this sudden cancellation until we got to the airport. Why not say something earlier or within the day so that we can plan accordingly? Our flights automatically got moved to Tuesday in the evening and we could stay here another day. We finally get to the front of the bag check line and we speak to the lady about the cancellation. Out of the 11 workers we spoke with during our time at the airport, she was one of the nice ones. We asked her if we could get any other flights tonight and she said there were none. She suggested we go to JFK and try but would not compensate us for travel to get there. Our flight was moved to Tuesday and it was Sunday evening. Where were we supposed to stay? They couldn't give us any hotel accommodations or nothing. They couldn't supply us with any solutions or offer to help or service us in any way which is poor customer service. We couldn't afford another night at a hotel so we actually ended up sleeping in the airport. They couldn't even supply blankets or nothing. We were just cold and freezing in the airport while we looked and googled for earlier flights, which are now double and triple the price. I'm talking $1,000 - $1,500 one way for a flight that was originally 300 or so. They couldnt even give us a refund for the flight. They just told us to call customer service. I had to wait 1-2 hours just to get a refund for that flight. So at this point we had to consider taking a bus until we finally found a flight with Delta the following day in the evening around 300. Fast forward to Monday September 11. We check in our bags go through everything and watching netflix by our gate until it was time to board. I think an hour or so before boarding I get an email saying that this flight is now cancelled. My friend and I check the screen and it still says the flight is on time. We went to the people at the gate who had to confirm whether or not the flight was cancelled. At this point we were getting even more frustrated because the same thing happened again. The customer service couldn't do anything for us. They moved our flight to Wednesday September 13. Again, no accommodation, no refund, nothing. The man acted like he did us a favor by giving us a food voucher for $32. What can $32 buy at an airport for 2 people? It was really frustrating because again we weren't notified until last minute of this cancellation. We decided to call and get another refund on the flight all while finding a bus that we could take to get home. We found 1 that was leaving at 10 pm and not too far from the airport. We purchased non refundable tickets, desperate to get home and thinking we would get there in time. We decided to get our bags that we checked and just take this bus. We headed to baggage claim and this was what really got me frustrated. We got there and our bags were not there! We had to wait 4 hours for our suitcases to come out. I asked countless workers where our bags were and we were either dismissed, ignored or not given a direct answer. Because baggage check took too long we missed the bus we were supposed to take and had to spend another night at the airport. We ended up taking a 6 am bus to finally get back home
The gate agent Victoria in Dayton Ohio was so kind and helped me so much. I approached her when she first started her shift before she even logged on. She was so courteous and relieved my stress.

Horrible! Tried to cancel my ticket. Agents were rude, they couldn't speak English properly, they were impatient and ultimately tried to rip me off by having me pay $99 in order to get a $242 credit (that would only have been good for 1 yr.) When I said that I wouldn't pay the $99 the guy said 'ok have a good day' and hung up. He also tried to string me along by saying 'we might be able to get your money back if you pay the $99' but he could not explain what missing information was needed in order to determine whether or not I'd get my money back. What a scam! Will never fly Delta again!!

Maintenance was not done to the airplane so they cancelled the flight and booked another one for us. We had to wait 8 hours at the airport. In Canada a credit or compensation must be made as stated by law. At the Delta counter they told the passengers to call Delta for the compensation. Numerous e-mails and calls were made to their customer service. Delta does not intend to conform with the law, which makes them a delinquent company. Now we have to deal with the Canadian transportation agency to get our compensation, which takes time. I don't recommend this airline to anyone and won't travel with them or any of their partners. I did not mind to book with a cheaper airline for a short flight, but we lost our time and energy in the process so we should have booked with a better company in the first place. Lesson learned! (Flight was in April 2022).

Delta told clients that SkyMiles never expire. Now Delta says they will be reset to 0 every year! This is unacceptable, they are breaking their own promise. This is the 2nd time Delta has cheated me. In 2023 I was offered an Amex card and 40k miles. I spent the required $4,000 in three months, got the card, used it and instead of the 40k miles promised, I was given only 35k miles which now are going to be converted to annually reset MSD dollars! I protested, I sent them a screen shot of the offer, but I only got a run-around. This is in addition to the much higher requirements for redeeming miles than most all other airlines.

Delta is getting unprofessional by the day! Push my time back 4 times in one day. Then putting me on a connection flight to NYC. Once I get to NYC they then cancel it, making me get a hotel without a voucher! Spending extra money after I just came from vacation. Then the next day for the flight Delta employees want to come to work late (flight attendants) pushing our flight time further back. What happened professionalism in Delta. So frustrating!

Delta Air Lines subcontracted with KLM for the first part of our trip from Prague to Amsterdam. My minor son and I (traveling alone) had to be up at 3am to airport on time. The flight Delta scheduled was not even flying that day. I had to be on the phone for over 30 minutes (while standing in the Prague airport with my child) desperately trying to get someone to change the flight to the correct one so we could make our way home to Boston. We ended up managing to sprint through the airport (mind you, this child also has a serious heart condition!) after having just 15 minutes to get to our gate. Since this trip, I have reached out to Delta to provide feedback, only to have them refuse to take responsibility for their mistake. Instead, they have blamed everyone else and straight out denied this even happened. I have phone records to prove my call took place. But they simply refuse to accept the blame. We will not be using Delta for our next European trip.

As I was boarding my flight from Athens to Boston, a women working at the Delta gate told me the airline staff are over heading my name. A few minutes later, I was boarding and had a comfort plus seat along with my husband. As I gave my boarding pass to get on, a huge siren went off and they told me to step back they needed to speak to me. I moved to the location they requested when a man working for Delta said in a pressured, loud and aggressive tone “There is a problem with your seat, the TV doesn’t work but we can move you to another seat with a working TV.” I hesitated because this all caught me off guard and said ok but show me the seat and it was a middle seat without the extra leg room. I said no and he said “Are you sure?” and I said I was traveling with my husband and if we can’t sit together we will just keep the seat with the broken tv in comfort plus. As it turns out that TV worked and Delta had been trying to give my seat to someone else for more money! About 15 years ago, I flew Delta and again coming back to the US from Athens, Greece I connected in Paris and they did a similar thing and asked me while I was seated in my seat to get up and they gave my seat that I had a ticket for and was already seated in to a man with the explanation that it was really his seat despite me having a paid ticket and boarding pass with that seat number. I had to stay in the airport for 5 hours waiting for another Delta plane. I never forgot that and it took 15 years for me to fly overseas with Delta again and now they did this. I never write reviews but want others to know as well as Delta that I will never fly with them again and will let everyone know about the scam they do, especially overseas to young women to take their seats for other passengers.

Delta issued an award ticket in March, 2023 for first class using 340,000 miles including a business class connection on Korean Air. Delta than cancelled and changed routings 3 times, resulting in loss of Korean Air Business Class ticket which both Delta and Korean Air refused to reissue, resulting in cancellation of my Korean Air Business Class trip and severe disruption to my annual vacation plans. Delta cannot be trusted for award travel - 1) Excess point requirements, 2) Very hard to get award travel, 3) When awarded, they will cancel and not reissue!

I just wanted to acknowledge the professional experience we received from one of their customer service representatives. My husband and I had just landed in Paris on 16 August 2023 around 1000 and noticed that his bag did not make the flight. I spoke with Delta Customer Representative. She did an exceptional job walking us through the process and in return decreasing our anxiety. We appreciate her caring and professional attitude which ensured we received the best experience possible. on a scale of 1-10, she is a 20!

Delta is not active duty military friendly. They did not help in any way when my sons orders got changed. I was absolutely appalled and am so glad there are many other airlines we can use found forward because no one in my family will ever fly with them again. I have 2 boys in the military and no airline has treated active duty military like Delta. Even Spirit Airlines was hassle free with last minute flight changes due to my son's orders being changed in the past. American Airlines, Southwest, Allegiant have all been super accommodating in making exceptions for active duty military. Shame on Delta for not supporting the military.

It's one of the best companies I've ever flown. The staff is very polite and communicable. There were no delays, I even came to the destination in advance. Was glad to fly with them, strongly recommend!

Delta is an incompetent airline through and through. From rude staff to airplanes constantly breaking, to the most disgusting terminal in every airport, Delta isn’t worth it. Don’t fly Delta unless you can burn 8+ hours on delays and enjoy being laughed at by the customer service personnel who are supposed to help you.

Plane was old and the small outdated screens were right in your face. 2 seats had sticky or broken seat back buttons. Very cramped seating. Worst of all, they were only serving snacks water and coffee from Florida to Atlanta to St. Louis. Nothing carbonated at all. This was the first flight of my life with no coke. Will never fly Delta again! Flight attendants were too casual. I did not belt at all and it went unnoticed until I belted in flight. Airplane mode not on also went unnoticed. Expected so much more from Delta.

My DELTA flight to London was delayed 4 TIMES because they couldn't find pilots. Then we boarded the plane at 12:45am and the pilots could not reach their INTERNAL Delta ground control to take off - the pilot announced this on the airplane as we waited on the plane. At 2am Delta CANCELED the flight and we all had to find hotels and didn't get a flight to late the next day. I didn't even have time to cancel one of my excursions with a 24 hour notice. Getting any sort of refund is a NIGHTMARE.

Don't trust the airline to update you fast enough if your flight is delayed and causes you to miss the next flight. My flight from Portland OR to Washington DC Dulles Airport originally had a layover in Seattle WA. Due to the first flight having a delay due to a light blinking for something that turned out to not be happening and them needing more fuel in order to be able to make the trip safely, I missed my connecting flight in Seattle WA. The flight arrived 5 minutes before the connecting flight was due to depart. I was unable to reach the gate in time, so I got in line for the customer service. I checked my texts, email and the delta app, but nothing showed up as having an alternate route. It took a while to get through the customer service line. When I reached the counter, I was informed that they had automatically booked me on a new flight even though I hadn't received any notification of this change. They printed my new ticket and said the new flight was due to depart in 15 minutes and was at the gate next to them. I walked over to the gate to find out that they had already closed the gate and weren't boarding the plane anymore. Therefore the tickets that customer service had given me were for a flight that had already finished boarding. So, I had to get back in line again. When I talked to the customer service representative, they told me that it was my fault for missing the second flight and because I had a basic ticket they couldn't help me with another flight option. That they could put me on a waiting list for an open seat going in the general direction. They said that I would just have to wait in the airport until a seat became available and they couldn't tell me when that might happen. I couldn't handle this news that I was stranded at the airport and had no idea when I might be getting another flight. I found a place to break down and cry and just before 11am my delta app notified me the info for the alternative flight that I had missed. This made me mad because this was two hours after I had needed it. So I collected myself and went back to customer service counter. The person who helped me didn't treat me like it was my fault for missing both flights and got me new boarding passes. This whole thing could have been avoided if I had gotten my notification about the reroute a lot sooner or if the customer service person had given me a ticket for a flight that hadn't closed there gates then say it wasn't their responsibility for the missed flight. Then on my last flight, the overhead space was a bit harder to reach then other planes and I am 4'11". When I had asked a flight attendant for help because I could reach they attendant told me she wasn't allowed to help me, which didn't bother me. But while I was struggling to pick up my bag high enough, the attendant told me that I was holding people up. A passenger ended up catching my bag as I was about to drop it and helping me the rest of the way.

My daughter and I flew from Savannah to Atlanta on flight 2516 on 8/28. Our flight was delayed by a 2 hour ground stop in Atlanta that caused us to miss our connection to Hartford on flight 1011. Despite a difficult situation beyond anyone's control, every Delta employee in the Savannah Airport, in the Atlanta airport, and in the air was courteous and professional in helping us and several hundred other stranded travelers get flights rebooked. We were able to get rebooked to flight 2069 for 7:05am the next morning and the airline gave us a complimentary hotel reservation and meal vouchers. I am sure that the airline did the same for several hundred people on this day and their commitment to customer service was refreshing and appreciated. thank you.

What is the worst US airline? I vote for Delta Air Lines! I took 3 domestic flights with them in the space of 2 weeks in July and they were all problematic. The first was over an hour late, the second 4 hours late, and the third landed in the wrong airport at midnight! I complained to Delta, of course. It took them a month to reply and offer me a laughable $25 voucher for future travel because it was due to factors outside of their control. I can believe that for one flight, but 3 out of 3 indicates a pattern of incompetence. Avoid Delta at all costs!

I will never use Delta again. Our flight was delayed an hour.  We sat on the plane for one hour. They came on the intercom and said "we do not have pilots to fly and you must deplane. Once in the terminal again they came on the speaker and said that the flight was canceled due to bad weather (even though we all heard inside the plane that they didn't have pilots. They told us that they would not pay for lodging for us. All passengers including myself saw several planes land and let passengers off ... so if it was weather related planes could land but not take off?

route: Great Fal s to Atlanta via Salt Lake City
review: Trash airline, said we had a 5 minute delay to fix something turned into an hour. Then told to deplane after sitting an hour to have to wait for another half hour til a new plane comes. If you have a chance to fly anywhere else other than Delta, I would suggest it.

The first horrible experience with Delta was on our departure day of Thursday, 08/17/2023 departing from San Antonio, TX. My twin boys and I boarded at 3:41 Delta Flight 1043, which had us wait inside the plane in 80+ degrees (inside the aircraft) for over a 1 hour while the crew tried to fix the AC and mechanical issues the plane was experiencing. This caused a delay in our arrival, and our plans changed due to the fact that we missed our car rental and hotel arrival time. After we departed San Antonio, it was hard to relax and watch a movie as the aircraft was having issues with the monitors, and they kept turning on and off three to four more times until they rebooted the system. On our return flight scheduled for Monday, August 21, 2023, our flight was delayed four times before arriving at the airport at 1 PM. While we sat at the airport waiting from 1 PM to 6 PM our flight was delayed two to three more times. Finally, after waiting all afternoon/evening at the airport, at around 9-10 PM we received a message from Delta saying our flight was delayed until 9 AM the next morning August 22, 2023. The Delta attendant informed us that the delay was due to the fact that Delta could not find a Pilot and the replacement pilot they found earlier, had declined as well, so they were left with no pilot and no choice but to push the flight until the next day. The customer service representative helped us book a hotel and offered us an embarrassing and very offensive $15 voucher per person. We arrived at the hotel with no clothes to change into, no toothbrush, no toothpaste, no hairbrush, no pajamas, and no deodorant, with absolutely nothing but dirty clothes we had on from waiting all day at the airport. It was almost 11 PM at night and every store was closed at this time to try and purchase anything. My kids (two 11-year-old boys) were tired, bored, and very impatient. Also, because it was past 11 PM we were extremely tired, and due to most restaurants and stores being closed we were unable to use the food vouchers. We had to wait an additional 20 to 30 minutes for the hotel shuttle to finally pick us up from the airport and drop us off at the Sheraton Hotel. The next day our flight finally departed LAX and we were extremely disappointed to be placed in an old and dirty aircraft with smaller TVs than the normal ones (We booked 6 first-class seats), please see the attached pictures for reference. We also left our vehicle at the San Antonio, TX airport for when we arrived and we had to pay two extra days of car storage at the airport due to our delay, which we do not think is fair. As if that wasn't disappointing enough for Delta, we received an email on 08/22/2023 from Customer Care offering us a $100 Voucher for the horrible experience. Due to the fact that our flight was delayed over 4 hours and per the trip delayed coverage in Delta's guidelines, we are entitled to up to a $700 travel voucher per ticket (4 tickets) and reimbursement for items we paid for during this delay. Delta refuses to take accountability for their actions and only offer us $20 vouchers.

route: Mexico City to London via Atlanta
review: I'm moved to write this review by Delta's extraordinary incompetence and unresponsiveness after a journey that should have taken 15 hours took 50 hours over the weekend of 12/13 August. Our plane from Mexico City was diverted by a storm 20 minutes from Atlanta and landed in Savannah (presumably because of lack of fuel – this was not a great choice of airport, as it has no customs for an international arrival). As a result of this, we sat on the tarmac for 5.5 hours (beyond the legal limit of 4 hours), given nothing to eat but a small bag of chips and two glasses of water. It turns out there were three such planes stranded on the tarmac that afternoon, one with no food or water and no functioning bathroom. The incident made the local online news and TV and was described as "unprecedented". Eventually night fell, the pilots left and we were deplaned and processed through a makeshift customs office, then told to find our own accommodation as Delta had no vouchers, but were explicitly told to keep all receipts. Airport staff booked a hotel for me and three fellow passengers. If I had known I wouldn't be refunded I might have slept in the airport. The next morning we showed up at Savannah Airport at 9 for our 11:30 40-minute flight back to Atlanta. I was rebooked onto my Virgin ATL-LHR flight at 6:40 pm. But we didn't leave Savannah till 5:30 pm! First, we were told the plane needed cleaning, then, as time passed, that Delta were now obliged to rebook every single passenger, including their onward flights, by hand, using a defective printer, and they would call them each by name. Chaos ensued, and the flight kept being delayed by another hour. Half the passengers left and hired cars out of frustration. Of course I missed my Atlanta-London connection for the second time in 24 hours. I was luckily rebooked onto a 10 pm Delta flight to London (not in Premium, which I had booked on my original Virgin flight). We were emailed $400 in Delta vouchers, not as a measure of our inconvenience but as a token gesture of apology. I would simply have liked a clean measure of my inconvenience. When I submitted $250 of receipts to Delta for reimbursement, I spoke to a representative about how I would receive the payment and was told a cheque would be emailed to my UK address. Subsequently, Delta informed me that none of my expenses were eligible for reimbursement as bad weather had caused the disruption. This, however, takes no account of a) their duty of care to stranded passengers and b) the sheer incompetence of Delta staff the following day at Savannah airport which caused many people to miss their onward connections. I have tried texting and calling and have repeatedly been fobbed off and held in lines. Delta, I should say, issued a useful food voucher of $30 at Atlanta airport (this was around 8 or 9 pm, though, the first food we had been given all day) and I was then emailed a transport voucher of $35 (for what?) which wasn't actually in the email. On the phone to Delta this week, I was offered 5000 miles as a token to shut me up, which I refused. And in an email I was sent a conciliatory $90 voucher, again not actually accessible from the email. I won't let this drop. Virgin, by contrast, have been charming and helpful, and promised me some refund on my non-flown Premium leg.

Delta’s slogan is “The world’s most trusted airline”? What an absolute crock! I can’t believe how this company operates is even legal, their airline customer service is by far the worst that I have ever experienced. I am absolutely disgusted with Delta Air Lines, they absolutely ruined the first day of vacation for my family and myself. They delayed our 5:30am flight 7 HOURS due to a mechanical issue. It ruined our entire first day of our vacation and we ended up having to book with a different airline last minute because Delta had nearly no other same day flight options except a red eye late night flight. We spent 5 hours in line trying to find other options, and probably over 10 hours by now on hold waiting to get customer service agents to pick up and help. We have spoken to 4 agents at least, and none have been willing to help or hold Delta accountable for the major inconvenience we had in our vacation due to their own doing. They cost us another 500 dollars each for the last minute flight change and only refunded us for the first half of the original trip. They are now refusing to cover the other flights we had to book even though the first customer service representative we talked with while at the airport during this mess told us they would, and have refused to provide any sort of voucher either. While we stood in line at our gate waiting to talk to the Delta attendant for help during all of this, they were giving out 1800 dollar vouchers for an overbooked flight and letting the volunteer passengers cut the line in front of us even though we had already been standing for an hour to rebook their flights. We didn't have a choice to be delayed due to Delta's maintenance issue and yet they are refusing to compensate us at all for any of our experience. It is totally negligent. The customer service reps told us they will do nothing for us and have refused to help any further.

route: Washington to Jackson Hole via Minneapolis
review: We had horrendous flights especially on the way to Jackson Hole and delays returning BOTH due to maintenance issues. On the way we had to overnight in St. Paul because we missed our connection, then took at 7am flight to Salt lake where we paid $770 to rent a car and drive 5 hours to get to Jackson. After multiple calls to CS and turn downs, I sent a FEDEX to the CEO requesting reimbursement for the additional car cost with receipts, nothing more, they didn't pay us the courtesy to respond. What kind of a CEO and airlines disses their clients like that - it's so disturbing.

My husband and I have always placed Delta as the best of the best airlines ever! We do not believe that anymore. Our travel agent booked our trip in February 2023 for our upcoming thirty eighth anniversary in August 2023. We arrived early at Atlanta on August 14, 2023. We did everything we were suppose to do, then went to our gate and sat waiting an hour and 15 minutes to board (Gate E15) When they called for Comfort Plus we excitedly got in line to board our flight D1970. When the agent scanned my passport and ticket it would not go through, the agent, who had a horrible attitude asked, where are you flying to?! I stated St. Lucia, she said they changed the flight to boarding gate E10 and the plane has already left. My husband and I were furious because nothing was announced, nor was our name called to let us know of the last minute change. My husband attempted to ask the Delta Rep when did the flight change? She rudely stated, I don't know sir. All I know is the flight gate was changed to E10, they were to depart at 9:45 am, but they departed earlier. My husband asked, what time did they depart? She stated at 9:43 sir. Please move out of the line. We missed our flight. We went to the Delta desk and the agent was no better. We advised her of what had happened and she said, I don't see that your flight was changed to another gate? She then kept looking and said, oh yeah, at the last minute they changed it, and you and your wife are listed as a no show. By this time we are heartbroken. We asked if there was another flight going out? She responded not today. We called our travel agent and she got a Delta Rep on the line for Delta Vacations and she was very unsympathetic. Our travel agent kept asking what could we do to fix this? The agent stated for us to go back to the Delta desk and see if they could book us on an other flight. We again advised we were told there were no more flights going out. We went back to the Delta help desk and the agent had the nerve to say: I don't know why they sent you back to me. They can see the same thing I can. She repeated that statement six times before saying there was nothing she could do. We called for a shuttle to return us back to our hotel, having to pay another $167 plus tax. Our travel agent was able to get us booked on the next day flight August 15, 2023 (this is our anniversary day). She got a Delta Rep on the line to see what compensation could be done and every agent we spoke to was adamant nothing could be done because it was our fault we missed the plane. We ended up losing a whole day (August 14,2023) at the resort, and had to spend more money for a hotel stay. To say the very least we are extremely disappointed in the way things were handled with Delta and will be using American Airlines or another airline moving forward.

All luggage and car seats for two adults and 5 children aged 6 mos. to 8 years put on plane, but we weren’t allowed to board because the gate door was just being shut when we finally got through security. The door was still open, but the woman gate attendant wouldn’t let us board. Now we’re stuck in the Seattle airport with 5 little children, no luggage, no car seats. It boggles the mind that the woman at the gate would actually do this. We have no idea what we’re going to do now. Sleep in the airport, I guess, with no bedding or change of clothes.  I will never fly Delta again, and I will discourage everyone I know not to, as well.

route: Los Angeles to Toronto via Atlanta
review: I traveled round trip to Canada and had to purchase a lay over flight because there was no flexibility for direct flights with decent arrival times. I had delays on BOTH trips (on 8/3 and 8/13). On my first round I traveled a red eye so I slept for most of the flight, did not eat or drink anything. When I woke up I asked the flight attendant if I could have water as she was making her trash pick up rounds. It was approximately 25-30 minutes before our landing time so I told her 'no rush' since I knew she was making her rounds. She looked at me and said, 'we're about to land'. I am a frequent flyer and I have NEVER been made to feel uncomfortable for a cup of water. I responded with, 'you know what, it's fine. I don't need it.' Another flight attendant brought me a cup once she was done with her rounds. Seriously, that's all she needed to do. I made her job easy through the entire flight by knocking out and staying out of her way until I needed ONE cup of water 30 MINUTES before landing. This is the last time I book with Delta. I gave them an extra star because the other flight attendants were cool but if you're going to delay my flight AND treat me like I'm bothering you when I ask for water you won't see me in those planes again. Also, they promote on flight entertainment yet have no bluetooth option for people with earbuds and you don't offer earphones in order to use the entertainment option you claim to offer. It makes zero sense. I had to resort to playing games since I had no old school earphones that plug into YOUR device. I'm glad I wore comfortable shoes b/c they changed gates AT LEAST 5 times when I waited in Atlanta and twice when I waited in Minneapolis. Like come on guys, we're paying tons of money for a service and I flew the lowest level. I would have been PO'd if I paid for First or Business class! Lastly, the on flight WiFi was so bad that I didn't use it after all. I contacted customer service to get into the online account before my flight on 8/3 and have not heard back from anyone. At this point I think they ignored my request for assistance.

route: New Orleans, LA to Augusta, GA via Atlanta, GA
review: Absolutely the worst flight experience ever! We do not recommend Delta. We booked our flight to fly my bf to GA to haul my RV with my truck to TN (job change) while I drove the car and had limited time to get it moved and get him back in time to make his flight for offshore work. So we opted for flying rather than driving to save time. That is not what happened. What was supposed to be 4.5 hours of travel time, including layover, turned into 19+ hours of travel due to Delta’s over 15 hours of delays. You read this right (we could have drove from LA to GA then to our final destination TN in less time than it took Delta to fly him). They had multiple delays (starting with staffing deficiencies). They left him stranded multiple times, literally, both at the airport with shuttle buses down for the night then left him stranded on a plane for over 6 more hours in delays, a detour to Savannah, more delays, refuelling more than once, before finally arriving 15 hours past his booked arrival time. This put us in terrible position and struggling with time constraints, put us in daytime traffic jams, and eventually having to rebook his return flight when we ran out of time due to Deltas unacceptable 15+ hours in delays. It cost us $135 more (taxi cost when stranded at the airport unable to get to the hotel and $100 in fees to rebook the return flight when we ran out of time due to Delta’s multiple extended delays) an enormous amount of stress, aggravation, and lost time. Delta’s offer to resolve this, a pathetic $40 flight voucher! This is not acceptable. We were not able to speak to a person and instead was forced to text, which added to the stress and aggravation. Worst customer service program we have had the displeasure to have to work through. We understand delays can happen but over 15 hours of multiple delays for such a short flight and leaving people stranded multiple times is unreasonable and unacceptable. If you actually want to make it to your destination and have any reasonable customer service, take your business elsewhere. Delta used to be a good airline, sadly that has changed to one of the worst.

In the past month and a half I have taken 3 delta flights. Like clockwork they provide outstanding customer service and lost all my bags every time! I flew from ATL to Boston Logan and they failed to load my bag on my flight. Like the professionals Delta are, it was loaded on the next flight an hour behind.  I was disappointed to hear I would be receiving my bag relatively quickly since it was on the next flight. However, my hopes were lifted when Delta told me it would take three days for them to deliver the bag a whopping 2 hour drive from Boston Logan to Hanover, NH. Thank goodness for Delta’s initiative or else I would’ve had to do a presentation in different clothes from those I’d worn the past two days! And I loved how unbelieving they were in my testimony when I tried to get them to compensate me for the clothes I had to buy because of their failure, absolutely beautiful. I was inspired by Deltas commitment to faithful customers, hard work, and service when I was flying from Atlanta to Boston and then to Lisbon for a vacation. Even when a storm came through ATL and they couldn’t seemingly find a crew to fly the plane they delayed my flight and made me wait for 3 extra hours. Lo and behold this delay would cause me to miss my connection in Boston, but no worries the Delta receptionist were available and attentive to my plight. They helped me reschedule my flight to Amsterdam. And they even remembered to forget that my bags had to be moved onto the new plane. I know when I fly Delta they have and deserve my utmost confidence in losing my bags. I wouldn’t receive these bags for the next two days and honestly it ruined the first half of my vacation. Obviously Delta will bear no shame in destroying my vacation. After I thought all was good they do something really great. I mean this just goes to show you the dedication they have to being a top tier airline. After they lose all 7 of my bags flying to Lisbon they actually don’t lose my bags coming back to New York. I was disappointed to hear my bags had landed in JFK. But upon waiting through my two hour layover I soon began to realize the baggage carousel wasn’t going to move.  I wait there for two hours waiting for my bags to come through the claim so that I could recheck them for my flight home. Guess what, they never came. So as I sit here on board a Delta flight back home, without my bags, I have come to be truly amazed by Deltas intelligence, dedication, and service. Guess I’ll go home and wait 2-3 more days before I have any of my bags. It’s okay though I don’t have anything to do. Delta should just take my bags and give the clothes and items to their staff. Open em up like secret Santa gifts at the office. I don’t care anymore.

I really only fly Delta because the airlines options are limited and they have free wifi, but after this trip I will be avoiding them and Tallahassee airport all together. Not even considering the issues I had to Seattle, on the way back from my overnight flight they put my luggage on a completely different flight that doesn’t arrive at my destination till 2 hrs afterwards.

Booked a simple 45 minute flight from Atlanta, GA to Augusta, GA. Take-off was delayed an hour or so due to weather. My plane eventually got in line to take-off from Atlanta. Waited in the take-off line for 45 minutes until the captain announced that the plane needed more fuel to take a detour? Spent another hour going back to the gate and “getting more fuel”. Another hour passes by and the plane finally takes off. We make it over Augusta around 12:00PM, the pilot announced they were circling around to see if it was safe to land. Next thing I know, we’re headed to Savannah, GA. Land in Savannah at 12.36pm, meanwhile the plane that left after us from Atlanta, landed in Augusta at 12.46pm. At 1.00pm my pilot tells everyone that they are going to wait for the storm to pass over Augusta before going back. My ride at the Augusta airport sent me photos of a clear skies at the Augusta airport. Pilot kept saying “they found a way around the storm and we will be leaving soon” - As if they were doing us a favor. It is now 1.50pm and the passengers are agitated and the flight attendants are arguing with each other. With no word on when we will be leaving to go to the destination we all paid for. No refunds, no apologies, typical.

My mother flew from Prague to Amsterdam and into Atlanta with no issue, but for some reason, Delta had a full meltdown in the hub city. After nearly being up for 24 hours of travel, her flight was delayed because of staffing issues, then three hours later, they boarded the plane, only to then return to the gate after taxiing and told the flight was canceled. My mom was then in the chaos of the line for flight/hotel accommodation for 3 hours. The call time for support is over a 2-hour wait. After filing a complaint with Delta about my mother not having access to her luggage I received a canned email blaming the cancellation on the weather. This is a lie. Other Delta flights took off after the cancellation (one that another family member was on).

I booked a flight for unaccompanied minors through a delta agent on the phone (credit card rewards had to be done this way). The agent completely ruined our experience. It was not until I arrived at the airport for check in that I was told there was a $300 fee ($150 each way) for the unaccompanied minors. I have sent them on other airlines without this charge. In addition to that, the return flight was booked as the last flight out. It’s Delta policy that they cannot take the last flight in case something happened and the minors were stranded. Makes complete sense, but again we were not informed of this issue when the DELTA agent booked it for us. This caused us to reschedule to another day, waste trips and parking fees to the airport, and take another day off work. So a rundown of surprise expenses due to the inept booking agent: Minor fee- $300 Airport parking- $30 Gas and taking time off work- $$ The airport agents were extremely understanding but limited with what they could offer. After submitting a claim explaining all of this with receipts, customer service granted me a $25 voucher for future flights. Use another airline that actually cares if things go wrong, especially when responsible.

We arrived in Detroit from Orlando and was expecting an approximate 1 hour lay over before heading to Buffalo International. Upon arrival in Detroit I received a notification that our flight would be delayed until 02:30. It was subsequently delayed two more times I believe, and then as we were preparing to board at nearly 03:00 the flight was canceled due to the pilot calling off or something to do with the pilot. Several Delta flights that night were delayed or canceled and I heard staffing mentioned by personnel for at two other gates. There were not other flights going out due to it being 3am and no other flights to Buffalo until approximately 36 hours later. I think there were only 3-4 Delta personnel in the airport to assist us but none of them could really help. I actually felt bad for them as they were taking a lot of grief from some very frustrated people. I connected with Delta at one of their service phones and was not really given any options and asked for a refund on my tickets so I could try to find alternate transport for my family of 6. I was told I would get $60 per ticket due to us completing the first leg of the trip (Orlando to Detroit). That was the morning of 7/22. It is 8/9/23 now and after a lot of follow up between Delta and the booking company, I am finally getting confirmation of the refund. However, I am only being refunded $32.14 per ticket, not $60. Since Delta could not fulfill their obligation to get my family home, we had to rent a vehicle, drive 6 hours home after spending 7 hours in the airport. I had to return that vehicle the following morning, to Detroit, so another 6 hours on the road. Since there are no one way rentals out of Detroit. I then had to wait approximately 5 hours in the airport to fly back to Buffalo. I was at least able to get my family home ... the new plane ticket cost me about $500 and the rental was around $250 and instead of getting home early Saturday morning, I spent the entire weekend traveling and did not get complete the trip until Sunday night. I am getting a refund of approximately $180 from Delta. I will never intentionally fly into Detroit airport and if I can help it, I will never fly Delta again. This has been a horrible experience overall.

Making economy class seats and bathrooms so small should be against the law. I am 5 ft 5" and 170 lbs. It is absolutely uncomfortable, claustrophobic and humiliating to be crammed into such small spaces. I have never been in such a small bathroom. It was impossible to avoid touching the sink, toilet and other surfaces just standing in the bathroom. My shirt got wet from the sink and I don't want to think about what other substances might have contacted my clothing. Its just gross. This experience makes me rethink any kind of airline travel for any reason. It is a terrible experience. On the return flight, my video screen didn't work. I mentioned it to the flight attendant. She had it reset but it didn't help.

route: Salt Lake City to San Jose
review: Unapologetic staff and horrible customer service. Does not accommodate to our problems that they started. They clearly do not know what they are doing. Delays on top of delays, on top of delays, that lead to cancellation. Absolutely unacceptable. Doesn’t even tell you why they are getting delayed.

Everything was going fine, but our joyful emotions quickly came to a stop when looking out of the window of the plane at JFK Airport and seeing ONLY our luggage being removed from the plane. After arriving to Europe and trying to use the "Delta Fly" app to track our luggage the only info we got is that our luggage is in Amsterdam. The day after we tried to track our luggage again only to get told that we need to call Delta Support. We called Delta Support and asked them where our luggage is. We were informed that our luggage will come to Europe on 6th of August and that when the luggage is being transported by a different company it won't show on the app which is completely outrageous when they can at least put the flight number of the plane of which the luggage is being transported by. Plus there is no info being sent by email, text or any other form. By the time I'm writing this review it's 7th of August 9:30 PM and our luggage is nowhere to be found.

First Class! What a joke! Priority boarding First Class first, but then they start boarding economy right on top of FC passengers so you don't have time to get your personal items and carry on in the overhead without economy trampling and falling over you. And FORGET FC service as soon as you sit down. 4 hour flight. Delta advertises hot meal on their web page. NOT! Chicken croissant sandwich and bag chips (only had 7 sandwiches out of 16 FC passengers) BOX LUNCH or quinoa and roast veggies BOX LUNCH or fruit and cheese BOX LUNCH. Seat arm BROKEN! Delta you have LOST YOUR WAY. You were paid BILLIONS by the government (OUR TAX MONEY) to stay afloat. YOU FORGOT customer service. DON'T FLY DELTA AT ALL.

Delta is a company that, according to the best in the world, but they are not, they have just made a mess that does not give any solution to the passengers. The flight from Atlanta to Quito should have left at 3:53 p.m. and arrived in Quito Ecuador at 8:00 p.m. .  They were kept there without any solution until 10:43 pm without giving them any solution and the problem is that my dad has a surgery scheduled on Monday and they are going to make the surgery wasted, they don't think about the passenger's life, they are just money, money, but for Charging is great but to help a passenger with a health problem they do nothing, they are the worst company and they have not even had the decency to solve this problem.  Delta es una compañia que segun la mejor del mundo pero no lo son acaban de hacer una embarrada que no dan ninguna solucion a los pasajeros el vuelo Atlanta to Quito tenia que haber salido a las 3:53 pm y llegar a Quito Ecuador 8:00pm. Los tuvieron ahi sin ninguna solucion hasta las 10:43 pm sin darles ninguna solucion y el problema es que mi papa tiene una cirujia programada el dia Lunes y ellos van hacer perder la cirujia no piensan en la vida del pasajero son solo plata plata pero para cobrar son buenisimos pero para ayudar a un pasajeron con un problema de salud no hacen nada son la peor compañia y ni si quiera han tenido la desencia de solucionar este problema.

route: Medford oregon to Portland, Maine via Grants Pass
review: I booked my son J's ticket and used our 100 e-credit, and the agent booked it for Portland, Oregon instead of Portland, Maine! The original price of the ticket was $276. So I called back, asked to talk to a manager to see if we could fix it or transfer the e credit back to my name. Then the agent came back on the phone and told me the manager fixed it and would give us the flight to Maine for the same Price! Now, I had looked up Delta prices and they were about 1200 from Medford to Maine, and I got his flight for $276. Wow. They really made my day. Excellent customer service!

My husband and i had to run through the airport in Atlanta because our flight from LAX ran late. Once we got in our seats the plane was ready to leave i knew there would be a problem with our bags! If we were rushed I knew they didnt have time to load our bags. We are at Harrisburg airport just getting a text "sorry your bags are in atlanta" You're not sorry Delta, see what happens when you rush! Then the lady telling me did they put reg tags on our bags to identify them to be put on the next flight? Well I didnt take your new employee training class to write notes for that! I feel Delta always has a problem, so upset

route: Detroit to Honolulu via Salt Lake City
review: Flight to SLC uneventful, was a good flight, just Beverages and Sun Chips. Flight to HNL was delayed for the second leg due to maintenance issues. Was promptly notified about the delay via the Delta app. For the second flight it was beverages and Sun Chips again! For a 6 hour flight! I get a warm meal for a 4 hour flight with ANA, warm sandwich with Cathay for a 2 hour flight. Good thing we bought a sandwich. Service was good and staff were nice, but please can you do better with the meal service.

route: San Diego to Augusta via Atlanta
review: If you wish to sleep on the floor in the terminal - by all means - fly Delta. Not only did they have this happen to us on July 20th on our trip to San Diego - due to staff shortage (left hundreds if not thousands of customers stranded in Atlanta) at midnight - with no hotels, no food, and a failed attempt two days later to buy us off with a $35 e Voucher. Delayed, delayed and then cancelled the flight and then even cancelled their alternative flight - spent whole night on floor in Atlanta terminal chasing flights. Thanks Delta. Then on our return trip - they did it again - they due to staff shortages - delayed flights and caused missed connections. Delta alternative was sleep in terminal again - midnight arrival to fly out next day at 9am. Unacceptable - so we got stuck renting a car in Atlanta at midnight to drive the remaining leg of our trip 3 hours. Deltas response - no reimbursement because we didn't accept their next morning flight. Laughable customer service. Speaking of which - try contacting their customer service - its a joke. It's all automated and they only talk by CHAT. Spend a good hour there - and then be told - sorry we cant see case numbers - you have to call. So you call the numbers - and guess what - they are disconnected saying you have to go to the website and use the Chat. Idiotic. Delta is a joke. They are overbooking flights and not reducing flights to look better for shareholders when their flights do not have staff. Then when the poor ticket holders get to locations - Delta delays their flights or cancels them (they already have the ticket holder $$) and then Delta tries to figure it out last minute. Grow up Delta, if you are short on staff, stop booking or offering flights you can't staff and then sticking it to the ticket holders and when it goes south (which it does) don't try and buy us off with pennies on the dollar e-vouchers. Worst experience ever.

I'm not a seasoned traveler so do not have a lot of experience. I was traveling about 5000 miles so was a bit worried there would be delays. I had two layovers, but thankfully all went well from NC all the way to HI. Thank you Delta job well done!

My experience with Delta has been beyond unacceptable the lack of customer service is quite disturbing considering the high recognition they received on top of being apart of the program for two years now. On July 30,2023 my domestic travel plans went from a 5hr travel day to 15 HOURS due to a minimum of a 585 min delay on my first flight which was never notified until a hour before boarding. Then, I was automatically rebooked for the next flight which followed by hours later being delayed again yet this time no notification until I arrive at the airport to print out my boarding pass. Yesterday, I had to travel three times to the airport just to make it home. With every flight rebooked being delayed I had no choice but to completely travel to Detroit just to make it make to GSO. I was never offered comfort at the gate nor on the flight for the inconvenience. Not one voucher or appropriate compensation was offered. Imagine being given the run-around by agents at the gate and customer care just to find out the following day none of the 7 phone calls to customer care on my travel day were EVER documented. Delta you should be ashamed that you cannot live up to the loyalty and funds your consumer provides you. Being offered only $75 dollars worth in SkyMiles or $175 gift card is insane when you have spent well over $400 combined. After I specifically informed the ATL supervisor today that yesterday a representative offered $250, she told me verbatim the because it was not documented she cannot accommodate me. Yet, with no hesitations the supervisor tells me if decline her today she will have to document this. Honestly is this how you all treat your consumers? Its truly disheartening the only solution this airline has for me is to fill out a complaint comment and wait and wait when I have waited more than enough on July 30,2023. It is clear to me that the airline does NOT CARE and has me reconsidering everything associated with this airline!

We are very frustrated with Delta and how everything was handled as a Reserve AX delta card holder and Platinum card holder and Gold medallion what ever they claim to title you which means nothing by the way. We have been using a good $10-20k a month on our card, we pay $550 a year and have never had an upgrade or been treated like a status they claim, no VIP, no Standby upgrades, It’s all a load of hype with no outcomes and only empty hopes and promises. When you call, everyone just passes you on to someone else with no solutions! The accommodations were lacking and unorganized. Waiting in line for 2 hours at an airport after flights were delayed so long we missed our connecting flight, then 4 hours at baggage to wait for missed plane luggage! To finally get our luggage that was damaged, I had no medication for way to long. By 1am we could not find any place to accept the food voucher, there was no shuttle to go to a hotel Delta gave us 30 mins away by the time we finally got a hotel, my bags were damaged and we were promised to be compensated to make up for these troubles and they are not offering anything close to fair. After one hour on the phone, 3 agents, multiple answers, no help, we were passed to the lowest customer service Delta rep I have ever spoke with! This did the final for me, so inexperienced yo handle any situations for a stressed out and upset customer who has been through the loop holes to try to get reimbursed and her attitude was just nasty and rude.  Delta is horrible and don’t listen to the customer, they also are not accommodating to people who have been through a tough time during their DELTA flight issues and especially the after the flight issues. I am not a happy Delta member. We are rethinking our choices, rethinking our membership and which card/company I we should look into because of the whole process of this last month with Delta and how they have been handling our situation is the worst experience I have ever had, ruining our family experience that is so hard to have and put together with our demanding schedules these days of precious time and a waste of my sanity and yearly money.

route: Rome to Miami via New York
